unnormalised: The summer of '23 was shaping up to be epic. My family, after what felt like years of planning, had finally decided to visit Kerala. The excitement was palpable, especially after my dad, Mr. Rakesh Kumar, triumphantly showed off the confirmed train tickets. "Finally!" he exclaimed, brandishing the printout with PNR no. 4567890123. My mom, Mrs. Priya Kumar, immediately started discussing packing lists, itineraries, and the best places to try authentic Kerala cuisine. Little did we know, this trip, filled with its fair share of hiccups, would be one for the books.
normalised: The summer of two thousand twenty three was shaping up to be epic. My family, after what felt like years of planning, had finally decided to visit Kerala. The excitement was palpable, especially after my dad, Mister Rakesh Kumar, triumphantly showed off the confirmed train tickets. "Finally!" he exclaimed, brandishing the printout with P-N-R number four five six seven eight nine zero one two three. My mom, Missus Priya Kumar, immediately started discussing packing lists, itineraries, and the best places to try authentic Kerala cuisine. Little did we know, this trip, filled with its fair share of hiccups, would be one for the books.

unnormalised: Our journey began smoothly enough. We boarded the Kerala Express from New Delhi Railway Station. I, being the ever-prepared one, had diligently saved screenshots of our ticket details on my phone, including the coach no. B3 and seat numbers 45, 46, 47 and 48. My younger brother, Rohan, however, was more interested in the onboard entertainment and promptly asked, “Bhai, wifi milega kya?” My dad, being a cautious man, double-checked the TTE’s ID – something along the lines of EMPNO12345 - before settling in for the long ride.
normalised: Our journey began smoothly enough. We boarded the Kerala Express from New Delhi Railway Station. I, being the ever-prepared one, had diligently saved screenshots of our ticket details on my phone, including the coach number B-three and seat numbers forty five, forty six, forty seven and forty eight. My younger brother, Rohan, however, was more interested in the onboard entertainment and promptly asked, “Bhai, wifi milega kya?” My dad, being a cautious man, double-checked the T-T-E’s I-D – something along the lines of E-M-P-N-O one two three four five - before settling in for the long ride.

unnormalised: Things started to get a bit chaotic when we reached Bhopal. Due to some "unavoidable circumstances," as the announcer eloquently put it, the train was delayed by 3 hrs. Suddenly, there was a frenzy of activity as people tried to figure out alternative arrangements. Some were frantically calling family members; others were pacing the platform, muttering about missed connections. My dad, ever resourceful, pulled out a flask of chai and some biscuits, reminding us that "everything happens for a reason."
normalised: Things started to get a bit chaotic when we reached Bhopal. Due to some "unavoidable circumstances," as the announcer eloquently put it, the train was delayed by three hours. Suddenly, there was a frenzy of activity as people tried to figure out alternative arrangements. Some were frantically calling family members; others were pacing the platform, muttering about missed connections. My dad, ever resourceful, pulled out a flask of chai and some biscuits, reminding us that "everything happens for a reason."

unnormalised: Eventually, we reached Kerala, albeit considerably later than scheduled. The backwaters, the lush greenery, and the aroma of spices instantly made us forget the train delay. We visited Munnar, Alleppey, and Kochi, each place more captivating than the last. I even managed to get a refund form for the train delay, the form number was something like RRF7890.
normalised: Eventually, we reached Kerala, albeit considerably later than scheduled. The backwaters, the lush greenery, and the aroma of spices instantly made us forget the train delay. We visited Munnar, Alleppey, and Kochi, each place more captivating than the last. I even managed to get a refund form for the train delay, the form number was something like R-R-F seven eight nine zero.

unnormalised: Despite the initial setback, the Kerala trip was a resounding success. The memories we made, the delicious food we ate, and the stunning landscapes we witnessed far outweighed the inconvenience. And now, every time we look at our photos, we're reminded of that chaotic, yet unforgettable, summer adventure, and that all important PNR no. which started it all.
normalised: Despite the initial setback, the Kerala trip was a resounding success. The memories we made, the delicious food we ate, and the stunning landscapes we witnessed far outweighed the inconvenience. And now, every time we look at our photos, we're reminded of that chaotic, yet unforgettable, summer adventure, and that all important P-N-R number which started it all.
